importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news report indicates the current state of food supply conditions in Gaza as of late October 2025, highlighting the urgency and ongoing humanitarian crisis following the ceasefire.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: This moment in time reflects the immediate aftermath of the US-brokered ceasefire, during which humanitarian aid deliveries are being assessed and expanded, but remain critically insufficient.

keyTakeAways: Food supplies to Gaza are significantly below the WFP’s daily target of 2,000 tonnes, currently at approximately 750 metric tonnes per day.
Only two Israeli-controlled crossings — Karem Abu Salem and al-Karara — are currently operational, severely limiting aid access.
The UN World Food Programme (WFP) operates 26 food distribution points, up from five, but still far short of the 145 it aims to establish across Gaza.
Humanitarian aid has not reached northern Gaza due to restrictions on access, including the closure of the Rafah border crossing until Hamas returns the remains of Israeli captives.
The WFP has not been granted permission to use the Salah al-Din Street, a major route, preventing large-scale distribution to the northern regions.
Residents in Gaza are rationing food and storing supplies due to ongoing uncertainty about the stability of the ceasefire.
The US president’s 20-point peace plan includes full humanitarian access, and its success depends on opening more border crossings.
Hamas has pledged to return 28 bodies of Israeli captives, having delivered 13 so far, and the Rafah crossing remains closed pending this condition.
Nutrition supplies for vulnerable populations (children and pregnant women) have reached northern Gaza via southern routes but remain insufficient.

namedEntities.name: UN World Food Programme (WFP)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A United Nations agency responsible for delivering food aid to people in crisis.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The WFP is central to the article as it reports on the current status of food deliveries to Gaza, identifies supply gaps, and calls for more open border crossings to meet humanitarian needs.

namedEntities.name: Gaza Strip
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian territory under Israeli military control, currently in a humanitarian crisis due to war and blockade.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Gaza is the primary location of the humanitarian crisis described, where food supplies are insufficient and access is restricted, making it central to the article’s focus.

namedEntities.name: Karem Abu Salem
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An Israeli-controlled border crossing into Gaza, currently operational.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is one of the two active crossings allowing food into Gaza, and its operation is critical to the limited flow of humanitarian aid.

namedEntities.name: al-Karara (Kissufim in Israel)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Another Israeli-controlled border crossing into Gaza, currently operational.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This crossing is one of the only two functioning routes for food delivery into Gaza, directly affecting the scale of humanitarian aid.

namedEntities.name: Rafah border crossing
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A border crossing between Gaza and Egypt, currently closed.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Its closure limits humanitarian access to Gaza’s southern and southernmost regions and is a major barrier to broader aid distribution.

namedEntities.name: Salah al-Din Street
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A major north-south road in Gaza, currently blocked from WFP use.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The restriction on using this route prevents large-scale aid delivery to northern Gaza, where food insecurity is most acute.

namedEntities.name: US President Donald Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The former US President who brokered a ceasefire and proposed a 20-point peace plan.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His role in brokering the ceasefire and proposing full aid access makes him a key figure in enabling or restricting humanitarian access to Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Israeli Prime Minister who stated that the Rafah crossing remains closed until Hamas hands over more captives’ bodies.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His position on the closure of Rafah and the condition for reopening directly impacts humanitarian access to Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian political and military group that has been at the center of conflict with Israel.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hamas is linked to the condition for reopening the Rafah crossing and has committed to returning captured Israeli bodies, which is a key condition for aid access.

namedEntities.name: Qassam Brigades
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A military wing of Hamas responsible for militant actions and prisoner-related statements.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Qassam Brigades confirmed the exhumation and handover of Israeli captives’ bodies, which is a key point in the ceasefire agreement.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The UN World Food Programme reports that food deliveries to Gaza remain critically low at just 750 tonnes per day, far below the 2,000-tonne target, due to only two active border crossings — Karem Abu Salem and al-Karara — being open. Despite an increase from five to 26 food distribution points, most are in the south and center, with no access to the north due to restrictions on Salah al-Din Street and the continued closure of the Rafah crossing. Humanitarian aid has not reached northern Gaza, and residents are rationing and storing food out of fear of renewed conflict. The ceasefire brokered by US President Donald Trump is seen as vital to sustaining aid, and the 20-point plan calls for full access to all crossings. Hamas has so far returned 13 of 28 captives’ bodies, with the remaining 15 still pending. The WFP emphasizes that opening more crossings is essential to prevent famine, especially in northern Gaza where the most vulnerable populations are affected.
title: WFP says food supplies to Gaza below targets, urges more crossings to open
